message: I'm in the Santa Ana/Costa Mesa area and tend to hang either at the Borders or Barnes and Noble at South Coast Plaza and the adjourning Metropointe. B&N is open later, but they don't have wall outlets for power. Borders has less seating, and something about my Macbook setup seems to have issues getting on the Verizon wifi when everyone else doesn't have the same issue (not specific to just one Macbook for me).
I started to put together a list a while back: http://bit.ly/ocwifimap
Borders is nicely situated right down from the Apple Store too.

Wait, Borders doesn't have less seating at all. In fact, it's got better seating because they don't give you a hard time if you use the cafe seating but don't buy anything. But only a few of their seats are within range of outlets, and their music is louder/more annoying.
